premise_source_doc_sentence: As of 2008 , 24 foreign language films have won Academy Awards outside of the Best Foreign Language Film category .

The Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film is handed out annually by the U.S.-based Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences to a feature-length motion picture produced outside the United States of America with a predominantly non-English dialogue track .

For the 1956 Academy Awards , a competitive Academy Award of Merit , known as the Best Foreign Language Film Award , was created for non-English speaking films , and has been given annually since then .
The Academy defines a foreign language film as a feature-length motion picture produced outside the United States that contains primarily non-English dialogue .

For the 1956  (  29th  )  Academy Awards , a competitive Academy Award of Merit , known as the Best Foreign Language Film Award , was created for non-English speaking films , and has been given annually since then .
